passages.text: USA | Media & Entertainment
Just Keep Swimming Through the Data: DIS July Summer Lull, NFLX Rounding

Key takes from our July analysis of web/app traffic and social media: 1) DIS+ web visits grew \(+23\%\) y/y, continuing a seq. slowdown (June / May were \(+34\%\) / \(+45\%\) y/y) with limited new releases. 2) DIS World trends improved in July vs June (app users \(+4\%\) vs \(- 6\%\) in June), but remains near bottom of the comp set. 3) NFLX Nielsen share of streaming hours \(8.8\%\) a record share of US viewing hours, driven by Squid Game 3.

DIS+ Slows Further & DIS World Stable. DIS+ web visits slowed to \(+23\%\) y/y down from a \(+45\%\) avg the prev 3 months as the release slate was relatively light. Only Murders in the Building is a key release in Sept. and we are curious if the recent ESPN DTC launch can drive higher engagement via bundled sign- ups. Additionally, DIS+ and Hulu should benefit from a wholesale deal that is expected to add \(\sim 10M\) subs in F4Q. DIS park traffic trends in July improved vs. June (DIS World app users \(+4\%\) y/y in July vs, \(- 6\%\) in June), though growth remains at the low- end of park comps. With DIS Experiences F3Q results solid despite weakening data, July is off to a good start. Cruises remains a standout with web visits up \(23\%\) y/y and app users up \(43\%\) .

Disney World Trends Improve, but Lag the Group: In the second full month of Universal's Epic Universe, Universal Orlando trends held strong with web visits and app downloads flat vs. June at \(+42\%\) y/y and \(+29\%\) , respectively. Disney World trends did improve from June, with web visits, app downloads, and app users \(- 8\% / - 9\% / + 4\%\) y/y vs. \(- 11\% / - 9\% / - 6\%\) , though all were behind the category averages of \(+4\% / + 1\% / + 18\%\) with notable pickups in trends at Six Flags, SeaWorld, and Busch Gardens.

DIS+ Drops To #3 In Comp Set, South Park Drives Paramount+ to #1: DIS had been #1 in our comp set on y/y growth in web visits Mar- May, however has now dropped in consecutive months, now to #3. In July, Paramount+ rose to #1 as South Park's new found virality drove audiences (+37% y/y in web visits & \(+15\%\) y/y in app downloads). DIS+ also fell behind The Roku Channel, but remained top 3 growing \(+23\%\) y/y+ronheart (Marvel) was the key release in the month, and debuted on the Nielsen top 10 weekly chart.

NFLX Best Month Since Jan, Reversing Weaker 1H Trends: NFLX grew its Nielsen streaming share of US viewing hours to \(8.8\%\) (June \(8.3\%\) / May \(7.5\%\) ), its best performance ever (2nd best Jan '25 at \(8.6\%\) ) and should help ease investors concerns over slowing engagement. The key releases were Squid Game 3 and Happy Gilmore 2. Netflix held 8 of the top 10 most watched shows / movies for the month of July (Nielsen).

Sports & News Remains Under Pressure: July and August face tough sports comps against the Olympics last year, with July category web visits down \(- 17\%\) y/y and social engagement down \(- 16\%\) . ESPN outpaced the category with visits down only \(- 2\%\) y/y.

Cruise Line Strength Accelerates, Web Visits up \(16\%\) y/y, Highest in 15 Months: RCL was again the largest contributor to the category with web visits up \(+25\%\) y/y, but all cruise lines grew web
Exhibit 1 - DIS+ web traffic grew \(23\%\) y/y in July, moderating from recent highs on content slate, but well above Jan/Feb levels
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies
Exhibit 2 - Para+ grew web visits fastest in July off a smaller base at \(37\%\) y/y from new seasons of Dexter and South Park. DIS grew \(23\%\) with NFLX down \(- 10\%\)

Exhibit 3 - Universal Orlando app users decelerated m/m, but remains a strong \(62\%\) y/y from the opening of Epic Universe. Disney World grew \(+4\%\) y/y, holding stable with recent positive trends.
Web Visits &amp; y/y RankParamount+1The Roku Channel2Disney+3Tubi4Peacock5Netflix6Hulu7MAX8
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies
visits and app users y/y as the category continues recent strength. DIS grew web visits +23% y/y, and app users +43%.

Data Methodology and Goals: The data below is US- only, and rank- orders y/y growth among brands, and how that rank moved vs. prior months. Top- ranked brands gaining places are seeing incremental momentum, with low- ranked brands seeing incremental headwinds.

How to read these charts: The below charts are in order of year- over- year growth in their respective category with the fastest growing rank and the largest decliner last. We then look at the number of positions that rank has changed compared to the prior two months. The primary purpose is to help find what brands are gaining or losing momentum, as opposed to what brand has the outright highest engagement.

For example, in Exhibit 4 from back in March: SEC Network had the highest y/y growth in web visits for May 2025 in its Sports/News category, and that #1 rank is up 9 positions from its February rank (#10) and up 10 positions from December (#11). So it had stronger y/y performance in March relative to other networks compared to its performance in February and March. With March Madness having two SEC schools in the Final 4 and the Florida Gators winning the championship it makes sense the SEC Network would see outsized performance and that momentum showed up in this data. We certainly hope this data can be more insightful than telling you who won March Madness, but it's an excellent example of how to read these charts.
Exhibit 4 - SEC Network had the strongest month from March Madness, Fox ranks down m/m lapping Super Bowl. ESPN remains largest volume by \(5x+\)
Web Visits Δ% y/y RankMar RankVs. FebVs. JanSEC Network1+9+10NBC2+1+1ESPN3+1+3NBC News4+1-3FOX5-4+5NBC Sports6+0-1TNT7+0+2Fox Sports8-6-1CBS Sports9-1-1CBS10+1-6ABC11-2-9
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies

DIS / NFLX: NFLX's dominant positioning is on display in our dataset as it represents \(30\%\) of mobile app users and \(40\% +\) of web visits (tracked). Hulu places 2nd in both at \(\sim 18\%\) of web visits and \(\sim 15\%\) of mobile users. Interestingly, DIS+ ranks 4th in both behind HBO Max. We do note our data only tracks the sign- up page of Prime Video.
Exhibit 5 - Netflix Represents \(\sim 30\%\) Of User Universe, Followed By Hulu and Max
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies
Exhibit 6 - Netflix and Hulu Represent \(\sim 60\%\) Of Web Visits Tracked
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies Prime Video, Only Tracks Sign Up Site

DIS: DIS+ was the #3 performer in y/y growth rates in web visits, trailing Paramount and The Roku Channel (PARA +34% y/y from Love Island), DIS+ downloads were in the middle of the pack at #5 after being 2nd last month. The release slate has remained light, with The Bear and Marvel's Ironheart as the top recent releases. Lilo & Stitch coming to streaming will be the next key release over the next couple of months.

NFLX: According to Nielsen, NFLX saw another sequential step up in viewing hours share to 8.8% (June 8.3% / May 7.5%). Given the investor concern over a weak engagement report for the 1H (only grew 1% y/y), this is a solid step into a strong 2H slate.

Other Highlights: Paramount was the clear standout as it rose to the top of both web visit growth and app downloads, likely attributed to South Park's virality. The Roku Channel was also a bright spot as it topped the comp set on both web visits and web visit duration. Peacock had the 2nd most watched show for July (Love Island according to Nielsen).
Exhibit 7 - Para+ grew web visits fastest in July off a smaller base at 37% y/y from new seasons of Dexter and South Park. DIS grew 23% with NFLX down - 10%
Source: Similar Web, Listen First, Sensor Tower, Jefferies

Exhibit 8 - ROKU channel continues to grow visit duration fastest. DIS+ grew 23% NFLX improved q/q but still down -10% y/y

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
